header.title: CosTime_UTO

erlref.modulesummary: This module implements the OMG CosTime::UTO interface.

description.p:
To get access to the record definitions for the structures use:
-include_lib("cosTime/include/*.hrl").

func.name: '_get_time'(UTO) -> ulonglong()
func.fsummary: Return the time associated with the target object

desc.p: This operation returns the time associated with the target object.

func.name: '_get_inaccuracy'(UTO) -> ulonglong()
func.fsummary: Return the inaccuracy associated with the target object

desc.p: This operation returns the inaccuracy associated with the target object.

func.name: '_get_tdf'(UTO) -> short()
func.fsummary: Return the time displacement factor associated with the target object

desc.p: This operation returns the time displacement factor associated with the target object.

func.name: '_get_utc_time'(UTO) -> UtcT
func.fsummary: Return the data associated with the target object in Utc form

desc.p: This operation returns the data associated with the target object in Utc form.

func.name: absolute_time(UTO) -> OtherUTO
func.fsummary: Create a new UTO object representing the time in the target object added to current time (UTC)

desc.p: This operation create a new UTO object representing the time in the target object added to current time (UTC). The time base is 15 october 1582 00:00. Comparing two time objects which use different time base is, by obvious reasons, pointless. Raises DATA_CONVERSION if causes an overflow. This operation is only useful if the target object represents a relative time.

func.name: compare_time(UTO, ComparisonType, OtherUTO) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Compare the time associated with the target object and the given UTO object

desc.p: This operation compares the time associated with the target object and the given UTO object. The different ComparisonType are:

list.item: 'MidC' - only compare the time represented by each object. Furthermore, the target object is always used as the first parameter in the comparison, i.e., if the target object's time is larger 'TCGreaterThan' will be returned.

func.name: time_to_interval(UTO, OtherUTO) -> TIO
func.fsummary: Create a TIO representing the interval between the target object and the given UTO midpoint times

desc.p: This operation returns a TIO representing the interval between the target object and the given UTO midpoint times. The inaccuracy in the objects are not taken into consideration.

func.name: interval(UTO) -> TIO
func.fsummary: Create a TIO object representing the error interval around the time value represented by the target object

desc.p: This operation creates a TIO object representing the error interval around the time value represented by the target object, i.e., TIO.upper_bound = UTO.time+UTO.inaccuracy and TIO.lower_bound = UTO.time-UTO.inaccuracy.
